newsitem.title: SYRIA: Syria says clashes signal new Arab uprising.
newsitem.headline: Syria says clashes signal new Arab uprising.

text.p: Syria said on Thursday that bloody clashes between Palestinians and Israeli troops in the West Bank and Gaza signalled the start of a new, more powerful uprising against Israel.

The official daily al-Baath newspaper blamed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for the violence, saying his decision to open an archaeological tunnel near a holy Islamic site in Jerusalem was "pushing the region towards war and not peace."
"It is natural that Netanyahu's measures be countered with a wave of outrage and fierce clashes with the occupation forces in all Palestinian areas...." the newspaper said.

"This is in fact a start of a new uprising that might be more fierce than the children's stone-throwing intifada. This uprising will have more power and new weapons which the Israeli authorities did not see before," al-Baath said.
